newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs higher by noon on talk of weak tankan.
newsitem.headline: JGBs higher by noon on talk of weak tankan.

text.p: Cash JGBs and futures rose by Tokyo noon on Tuesday on speculation that the Bank of Japan's "tankan" corporate sentiment survey would provide further signs that Japan's economic recovery may be faltering, traders said.
The key September was at 124.11 at midday, up from 123.91 on Monday.

The September rose to a high of 124.30 on widespread talk that a senior BOJ official had suggested in a closed meeting with some Japanese bank managers on Monday that the tankan results would be weak, traders said.
There was also talk that a long-term bank, which may have attended the meeting with the BOJ official, received a large amount of seven-year interest rate swaps.
This appears to have induced buying of JGB futures for hedge purposes by traders who paid seven-year swaps.
In early trade, JGBs were also buoyed by talk that JP Morgan, which had previously made optimistic forecast for the tankan, revised it down, traders said.
JP Morgan's chief economist in Tokyo, Jesper Koll, told Reuters on Tuesday that he had not revised a forecast of plus four for the tankan's manufacturers' diffusion index.
The yield of the benchmark 182nd 10-year JGB was at 2.370 percent, down from Monday's 2.390 percent.
The fall in Tokyo stocks following the overnight tumble on Wall Street also helped JGB prices.
